column7: Rich soils[235] in open woods, clearings, fields and prairies[43].
column8: Eastern N. America - New York to Ontario, south to Florida and Louisiana.
column16: Sabatia angularis is a ANNUAL/BIENNIAL growing to 1 m (3ft 3in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 6.  It is in flower from July to August. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs).  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist soil.
column20: Tea: the various herb teas that can be used in place of tea, plus the genuine article.
column21: A tonic tea is obtained from the plant[4, 61]. The part of the plant is not specified.
column22: Antiperiodic: Counteracts recurring illnesses such as malaria.,Tonic: Improves general health. Slower acting than a stimulant, it brings steady improvement.
column23: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.Antiperiodic  TonicAntiperiodic, tonic[4, 61]. Used as a bitter stomachic, similar in its action to Gentiana lutea[207]. An infusion of the plant has been used to treat period pains[257].
column27: Requires a moist soil[200]. This species provides an excellent cut flower[200].
column28: Seed - best sown as soon as it is ripe in late summer or early autumn. Sow in a peaty soil in a moist shady border or sow in pots in a shady part of the cold frame and keep the soil moist by standing the pot in 2 - 3cm of water[1].
